title: Eric Adams Considers Endorsing Cuomo
summary: The New York City mayor said he has been in discussions to back former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, and maintains his opposition to Assemblyman Zohran Mamdani, the front-runner.

title: Military Commander Overseeing Escalating Attacks Off Venezuela Coast Is Stepping Down, Officials Say
summary: Adm. Alvin Holsey is leaving less than a year into his tenure, and as the Pentagon escalates attacks against boats in the Caribbean Sea.

title: U.S. Military Killed Venezuelan Fisherman in Suspected Drug Boat Attack, Family Says
summary: For the first time, one of the 27 people killed in U.S. airstrikes on suspected drug vessels has been publicly identified.

title: U.S. B-52s and Helicopters Fly Near Venezuela in Show of Threats
summary: The Trump administration is sharply increasing U.S. military pressure on the government of Nicolás Maduro.

title: Trump’s Unilateral Spending Cuts Complicate Shutdown Deal
summary: Democrats want guarantees that President Trump will not continue to claw back spending, ignoring any agreement they strike. But he has promised to keep defying Congress.

title: Trump Plans to Meet With Putin to Talk About a Cease-Fire in Ukraine
summary: A day ahead of his meeting with Ukraine’s leader at the White House to discuss an arms package, President Trump suggested that Russia might be open to a diplomatic solution to the war it started.

title: Russia Is Arming Drones With North Korean Cluster Weapons, Report Says
summary: Though Pyongyang has largely pulled its soldiers off the front lines in Ukraine, it is expanding the types of ammunition it supplies to Russia.

title: Ace Frehley, Kiss Guitarist and Founding Member, Is Dead at 74
summary: A consummate showman, he was known for playing guitars rigged with pyrotechnic effects and for his distinctive stage persona.

title: She Self-Deported. Now She and Other Crime Survivors Are Suing ICE.
summary: Lawyers argue that the agency’s new policies have led to the detention and removal of victims of domestic violence and trafficking, despite their legal protections.

title: Appeals Court Maintains Block on Trump’s Troop Deployment to Illinois
summary: “Political opposition is not rebellion,” wrote a Seventh Circuit panel, rejecting an attempt by the Trump administration to remove an order by a trial court judge.

title: Venture Capitalist Ron Conway Resigns From Board Over Benioff National Guard Comments
summary: Ron Conway stepped down from the board of Salesforce’s philanthropic arm after the company’s chief executive, Marc Benioff, said he supported President Trump and wanted the National Guard to come to San Francisco.

title: Wisconsin Man Used TikTok to Call for the Killing of ICE Agents, U.S. Says
summary: Andrew Stanton, 38, was charged with threatening federal law enforcement officers, whom he said should be shot. He pleaded not guilty and remains in custody.

title: Ben Stiller Honors His Parents In ‘Stiller & Meara: Nothing Is Lost’
summary: How to lead an artistic life and be part of a family is a tension he has only recently faced in life and now, onscreen, for a film about his comedian parents.

title: Trump Warns Hamas of Strikes if Violence in Gaza Continues
summary: The president later clarified that the United States would not be involved in such an action.

title: What’s Next for the Gaza Cease-Fire Plan
summary: Israel and Hamas have reached a cease-fire deal in Gaza, but the hard part starts now. David Sanger of The New York Times describes the major obstacles to further agreement about Gaza’s immediate future.

title: Yemen’s Houthis Confirm Killing of Top Military Official
summary: It was unclear when Maj. Gen. Mohammed al-Ghomari was killed, or by whom, but Israel appeared to claim the killing.

title: Kanchha Sherpa, Last Member of First Team to Conquer Everest, Dies at 92
summary: A trip to India to find work led to a career climbing the world’s highest mountain.

title: Parties Brace for a Political Future Without the Voting Rights Act
summary: After the Supreme Court appeared poised to weaken a key provision of the landmark civil rights law, both parties began to reckon with an uncertain future.

title: Little Fliers Everywhere
summary: They’re not just for missing pets or yard sales. Fliers these days are for internet memes, self-promotion and extremely esoteric messages.

title: Something Is Stirring in Christian America, and It’s Making Me Nervous
summary: Don’t mistake a revolution for a revival.

title: Amy Coney Barrett Is Looking Beyond the Trump Era
summary: The Supreme Court justice isn’t making decisions based on public opinion.

title: John Bolton Is Indicted
summary: Also, Trump and Putin plan to meet. Here’s the latest at the end of Thursday.

title: Can’t Find the Right Holiday Gift? We Can Help!
summary: Ahead of the holidays, we’re responding to readers’ hardest gifting quandaries.

title: After Racist Texts, New York G.O.P. Is Set to Disband Young Republicans
summary: State party leaders are expected to eliminate the charter of the Young Republicans group, allowing them to reconstitute the organization with new leaders.

title: Jeffrey Meldrum, Scholar Who Stalked Bigfoot, Dies at 67
summary: His willingness to bring scientific rigor to Sasquatch studies earned him the gratitude of enthusiasts and the withering scorn of debunkers.

title: JB Pritzker Won $1.4 Million Playing Blackjack in Las Vegas
summary: The Illinois governor reported the winnings on his 2024 tax returns, which his campaign released this week. “I was incredibly lucky,” he said.

title: Diane Keaton’s Cause of Death Revealed as Pneumonia
summary: A death certificate released Thursday said that the Oscar-winning actor died on Oct. 11 of bacterial pneumonia.
